Steps.Message: We became aware of a power cut at 10:57. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly.
Steps.Name: Reported

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.
Steps.Name: Engineers on their way

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.
Steps.Name: Investigating & fixing

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: A fault has occurred on an underground electricity cable affecting the local area, we may have to dig up the road to carry out repairs.
PlannedIncidentReason: We're carrying out planned work in your area. For our engineers to carry it out safely they need to turn the power off. We're doing this work as it's essential to provide reliable electricity supplies to your area. We're sorry for any inconvenience caused and thank you for your patience.
MainMessage: We are aware of an incident caused by LV UG Network Fault affecting the electricity supply in your area. Our engineers are dealing with this, but we are sorry we can't give you a time for the restoration of supply at present.  Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

Our engineers are dealing with this and we estimate that most supplies will be restored by 25-DEC-2025 17:30.  Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

Steps.Message:
Sent by David at 06:14 -  Hi David here. I'm sorry for how long the power was off especially on this festive period. Thank you for your patience while our engineers continue works on the underground network in the Westcliff Drive area. We have now restored power to all but one property. We're sorry for any disruption this unexpected power cut caused.

If your power isn't back on, we'd still like to keep you updated. If we aren't currently in contact with you by phone or in person at your property, please call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hi there. We've just had a shift change, so David, Stuart, Decasta and Adam are now here to keep you updated with progress from our field teams.

We know it's frustrating being without power, but we wanted to assure you we're still here and as soon as we have some more information we'll update you again.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Luke at 05:50 - Our engineers are are still on site working on repairs and are still aiming to complete work and restore power between 06:30 and 07:30.

We're sorry for the disruption this power cut will be causing, especially the impact it will be having on the start to your day. If you have any concerns about this please do not hesitate to contact our Customer Services team any time.

We will work to fix the problem as quickly and safely as possible.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: We became aware of a power cut at 20:31. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly.

Steps.Name: Investigating & fixing

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We're investigating a transformer fault on the electricity network that has caused a power cut in the local area.
PlannedIncidentReason: We're carrying out planned work in your area. For our engineers to carry it out safely they need to turn the power off. We're doing this work as it's essential to provide reliable electricity supplies to your area. We're sorry for any inconvenience caused and thank you for your patience.
MainMessage: We are aware of an incident caused by LV Plant Fault affecting the electricity supply in your area. Our engineers are dealing with this and we estimate that most supplies will be restored by 27-DEC-2025 13:00.  Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Lisa at 21:52 - We can now confirm that all power in the Windermere Avenue  area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected fault with some of our network equipment, which our engineers have now replaced.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our team of specialist engineers have now begun to arrive to locate and fix the underground cable fault.

At the moment we don't need to change our estimated time frame, and we'll continue to keep you updated with all of our progress as it comes in from site. Sent by Lisa at 20:41.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Lisa at 19:47 - Thanks for bearing with us over today, I just wanted to give you the latest from our engineers. Our staff have now confirmed that our substation equipment has operated due to an underground cable fault which we'll need to pinpoint, excavate and repair. We're sending specialist teams and equipment to site, and it's possible they will still be able to restore your power within the current time frame using other methods. However, once they've assessed further we'll let you know if the time frame needs to change. For more information about this type of fault; here's a short video https://bit.ly/2ScxQDZ - I'll keep you updated.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Name: Investigating & fixing

Steps.Message:
Sent by Luke at 05:32 - Thank you for your patience while our engineers worked on the underground fault network in the Draycott Place area. We have now restored power to all but one property. We're sorry for any disruption this unexpected power cut caused.

If your power isn't back on, we'd still like to keep you updated. If we aren't currently in contact with you by phone or in person at your property, please call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Luke at 04:36 - Thanks for your patience over tonight.

Our engineers have let us know that they have restored more properties, with 43 now still without power but it will take them longer to get all power back on. The estimated time frame to restore all power is now between 08:30 and 09:30.

We're sorry this is taking longer than expected, and we'll continue to keep you up to date, but if any change to this time comes in from our staff I'll let you know as soon as we hear.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Hi, Luke from the messaging team here; just a quick recap on what's happened during the power cut so far. Our engineers are on site in the Draycott Place area. We have managed to get power restored to 70 properties, so currently 204 properties are still affected by a faulty underground cable. We are still aiming to have the power back on between 04:30 and 05:30. If your power is back on now, please follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to stop SMS updates. I'm sorry for the continued disruption, but I'll keep you informed with news from site. If you have any concerns, please call us on 08003163105.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

PlannedIncidentReason: We're carrying out planned work in your area. For our engineers to carry it out safely they need to turn the power off. We're doing this work as it's essential to provide reliable electricity supplies to your area. We're sorry for any inconvenience caused and thank you for your patience.
MainMessage: We have repaired the problem with the electricity supply in your area. There may still be some tidying up to do, and any details have been passed to our Maintenance department, who will attend to it as soon as possible. Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

Steps.Message: Sent by Stuart at 11:07 - We're sorry for the disruption to your power today, especially for those who may be more vulnerable without the electric. If you're worried about an elderly or ill person in your property who is affected by the power cut today, we are able to provide some support. For more information just click here: https://bit.ly/40quttu If you have any further concerns or questions though, don't hesitate to call us free on 08003163105. We'll continue to keep you updated with our engineer's progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: We became aware of a power cut at 03:20. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly.
Steps.Name: Reported

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.
Steps.Name: Engineers on their way

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.
Steps.Name: Investigating & fixing

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: A fault has occurred on an underground electricity cable affecting the local area, we may have to dig up the road to carry out repairs.

MainMessage: We are aware of an incident caused by LV UG Network Fault affecting the electricity supply in your area. Our engineers are dealing with this and we estimate that most supplies will be restored by 27-DEC-2025 12:00.  Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Stuart at 09:09 - We can now confirm that all power in the area should be back on. Our engineers had to unexpectedly turn off the power for safety due to a gas leak near electrical equipment in the Heron Way area.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Stuart at 07:21 - We're very sorry we've had to switch off your electricity.

Our engineers have turned off the power in the Heron Way area for safety due to a gas leak. I'm afraid at this stage we are unable to provide a time frame for your power to return, but once we have been advised by the gas board and fire service that it is safe to do so then our engineers will begin their investigations to ensure there is no damage to the network.

I'll be back in touch when we have further updates from the team on site.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Our engineers have turned off the power in the High Road area for safety due to a fire near electrical equipment. IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We're investigating an overhead electricity line fault which has caused a power cut in the local area.
PlannedIncidentReason: We're carrying out planned work in your area. For our engineers to carry it out safely they need to turn the power off. We're doing this work as it's essential to provide reliable electricity supplies to your area. We're sorry for any inconvenience caused and thank you for your patience.
MainMessage: We are aware of an incident caused by LV OH Network Fault affecting the electricity supply in your area. Our engineers are dealing with this and we estimate that most supplies will be restored by 27-DEC-2025 12:00.  Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

Steps.Message:
Our team of specialist engineers are now beginning to arrive on site. Based on what we know about the issue so far, and to allow them time to locate the fault for excavations and repairs, we've changed the estimated time to between 16:00 and 17:00.

We're sorry to have to change the time frame but we'll keep you updated with progress. If you have any questions or concerns, our team are always here to help on 105. Sent by Stuart at 11:15.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Stuart at 11:09 - Hello again. Thanks for your patience today, I can see from our engineer's notes that your lights may have come on and gone back off several times since we've been made aware of the issue, and I'm sorry if this is causing you any worry. As we've explained in previous messages, our staff work to divert power when a fault like this happens. Sometimes, these diversions can be unsuccessful, so we have to try routing power another way; this is why your lights are going off and on. If at any point your power comes back on, you can always stop SMS updates here - https://bit.ly/348KOZ3
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Stuart at 10:02 - Thanks for bearing with us over today, I just wanted to give you the latest from our engineers. Our staff have now confirmed that our substation equipment has operated due to an underground cable fault which we'll need to pinpoint, excavate and repair. We're sending specialist teams and equipment to site, and it's possible they will still be able to restore your power within the current time frame using other methods. However, once they've assessed further we'll let you know if the time frame needs to change. For more information about this type of fault; here's a short video https://bit.ly/2ScxQDZ - I'll keep you updated.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Stuart at 09:55 - Our engineers have been able to divert electricity around the faulty part of the network, restoring power to some customers. We know your power may now be back on, however; we'll keep sending text updates to everyone until all the power to your area is on. To stop receiving texts, just follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Stuart at 11:00 - Hi - thanks for bearing with us, I know a power cut can be very disruptive. We've had an update from our staff that there are now 65 properties still affected by the overhead network fault, as they have managed to safely divert some power, getting the lights back on for 246 of our customers. We'll keep sending text updates to everyone until all the power to your area is on. To stop receiving texts, just follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Stuart at 10:48 - Thanks for your patience this morning.

Our staff are checking our equipment throughout the area to pinpoint the issue on our overhead cabling network. In addition to this, they are liaising closely with our control room to find safe and reliable ways to divert power around any problems and get everyone restored.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them. We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have arrived on site in the Feltwell IP26 4 area to investigate the power cut affecting 311 properties.

Specialist engineers are also working to divert power remotely, and this can cause your lights to go on and off.

We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can. We'll update you with all of our progress but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time. Sent by Stuart at 10:35.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: We became aware of this power cut at 09:27. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.
Steps.Name: We are restoring customers automatically

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.
Steps.Name: Engineers on their way

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.
Steps.Name: Investigating & fixing

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We're investigating a high voltage overhead electricity line fault which has caused a power cut in the local area.

Logs.Comment:
Sent by Stuart at 11:33 - Hello again. Thanks for your patience today, I can see from our engineer's notes that your lights may have come on and gone back off several times since we've been made aware of the issue, and I'm sorry if this is causing you any worry.

As we've explained in previous messages, our staff work to divert power when a fault like this happens. Sometimes, these diversions can be unsuccessful, so we have to try routing power another way; this is why your lights are going off and on.

If at any point your power comes back on, you can always stop SMS updates here - https://bit.ly/348KOZ3

Sent by Stuart at 11:00 - Hi - thanks for bearing with us, I know a power cut can be very disruptive. We've had an update from our staff that there are now 65 properties still affected by the overhead network fault, as they have managed to safely divert some power, getting the lights back on for 246 of our customers.

We'll keep sending text updates to everyone until all the power to your area is on. To stop receiving texts, just follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe.

Sent by Stuart at 10:48 - Thanks for your patience this morning.

Our staff are checking our equipment throughout the area to pinpoint the issue on our overhead cabling network. In addition to this, they are liaising closely with our control room to find safe and reliable ways to divert power around any problems and get everyone restored.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them. We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.

Our engineers have arrived on site in the Feltwell IP26 4 area to investigate the power cut affecting 311 properties.

Specialist engineers are also working to divert power remotely, and this can cause your lights to go on and off.

We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can. We'll update you with all of our progress but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time. Sent by Stuart at 10:35.

PlannedIncidentReason: We're carrying out planned work in your area. For our engineers to carry it out safely they need to turn the power off. We're doing this work as it's essential to provide reliable electricity supplies to your area. We're sorry for any inconvenience caused and thank you for your patience.
MainMessage: We are aware of an incident caused by 11kV OH Fault affecting the electricity supply in your area. Our engineers are dealing with this and we estimate that most supplies will be restored by 27-DEC-2025 12:30.  Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Stuart at 10:11 - Thanks for your patience today. Our engineers have now investigated the low hanging overhead line, and have deemed it safe to restore power back to all 389 properties in the Kelvedon and Rivenhall area.

We're very sorry we had to turn your power off unexpectedly, and with so little warning. We usually provide much more notice if we can, but in a situation like this our first priority is the safety of the public and our staff.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. If your power is still off or if you have any questions, call our team on 08003163105.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: We became aware of this power cut at 09:29. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.

Steps.Message: Sent by Stuart at 10:15 - Our engineers are on their way. We believe the issue is an underground network fault that initially interrupted power to 505 properties.
